title: Jewish Lore Reactions: Prologue
paragraph:
Shalom friends! Let's go on an ‚ú®epic quest‚ú® to explore the characters, stories, legends, folklore, art, and song that form the collective narrative world-building of the Jewish people. Shape-shifting Elijah the Prophet. Memory-keeper Serach Bat Asher. Ashmodai, King of the Demons. The wise (sometimes) King Solomon. Agrat, and her Gang of Destroying Angels. Lilith. Dybbuks. Golems. The overworked Angel of Death, and his inept intern Chad. It's giving "creative resiliency." Welcome to #JewishLoreReactions, the new #DafReactions spinoff series! ü™¨

Visit miriamanzovin.com/jewish-lore-reactions for a list of the incredible experts who consulted on this project, as well as a selected reading list of the books and sources that simmer in this "cauldron of story." (Or, perhaps, the cholent/hamin/t'beet/dfina of story, in this case üòä)

title: Jewish Lore Reactions: Will The Real King Solomon Please Stand Up? Part I
paragraph:
Shalom friends! Wanna hear a shocking cautionary tale about identity theft between Ashmodai, King of the Demons and the Biblical King Solomon? That also somehow involves a ‚ú®MAGIC WORM‚ú®?! Gather ‚Äòround the phone screen, and let me tell you the story...
-----
I want to recognize the devastating news of last night/this morning, unbearable on top of all the months of nightmare horror. Creating a space on my platforms for Jewish joy has felt like a vital goal for me in the midst of this hellscape, which is why I do not often make videos about pain. But the truth is many of the stories in this new series have come out of the darkest experiences in our history, as we have always been storytellers to help us keep going, to be resilient, to remember, to honor, to uplift, to heal. If you are not in the mindset to watch something funny right now, I completely respect that. If you on the other hand are looking to briefly escape this reality into one of collective imagination, please do watch this video, and enjoy.

title: Will the Real King Solomon Please Stand Up? Part II
paragraph:
Shalom, friends! Welcome back to #JewishLoreReactions: Will the Real King Solomon Please Stand Up? Part II
Solomon has been resoundingly yeeted, but will a shocking report from the harem lead to Ashmodai being, um, de-feeted? The drama continues!  #Folklore #Jewish #Folktales #Aggada #Talmud  üëë üòàüêî

title: Jewish Lore Reactions: Agrat and the Destroying Angels
paragraph: Shalom, friends! Welcome back to #JewishLoreReactions! On this episode, meet Agrat, demon queen and mother of Ashmodai, who rolls deep with a squad of 180,000 angels of destruction in an intersectional coalition of mutually supportive absolute menace! üëëüòàüíÉ

title: Jewish Lore Reactions: Ride or Ashmodai Part I
paragraph:

This is a fairytale about a demon-human divorce. A horror story about what happens when Ashmodai‚Äôs daughter, the demon princess Ufrut, marries a vile human man.
Welcome to #JewishLoreReactions, Ride or Ashmodai, Part I ‚ú®

title: Jewish Lore Reactions: Ride or Ashmodai, Part II
paragraph:
Our story of Ufrut, demon princess and daughter of King Ashmodai continues. Her oathbreaking POS human husband has made her an #agunah, a chained woman. And now, it‚Äôs time‚Ä¶for REVENGE.

title: The Story of Judith: A Jewish Lore Reactions Hanukkah Special!
paragraph:
Shalom, friends!
The holiday of #Hanukkah is here!
So it‚Äôs time for me to tell you the epic story of a daring and üî• extremely attractive üî• assassin who, against all odds, took out a high-ranking enemy leader to save the oppressed! title: Jewish Lore Reactions: A Work-Death Balance
paragraph:
King Solomon, renowned for his wisdom, noticed that one of his friends was going through a tough time. We‚Äôve all been there. Especially in February.  Highly relatable. You want to help, to listen, to be present for them. But not gonna lie, it‚Äôs a bit trickier when your friend‚Ä¶happens to be the Angel of Death. 

Welcome to Jewish Lore reactions: A Work-Death Balance!

Sources: Brachot 4b, Sukkah 53a, Moed Katan 28a, Avodah Zarah 20b, Sotah 46b, Bereshit Rabbah 69:8, Tree of Life (Schwartz) pg 476-8

title: Jewish Lore Reactions: The Wrong Miriam
paragraph:
Shalom friends,
The Angel of Death was fully in his #bossbabe era.
But with such a busy career, perhaps trying to manage a new, inept intern as well had just added too much chaos.
Maybe it was inevitable that something would go‚Ä¶horrifically wrong.
Welcome to #JewishLoreReactions: The Wrong Miriam
#notallMiriams 

This story is based on: Brachot 6a, Chagigah 4b and 5a, Avodah Zara 35b, Bava Kamma 60b, Zohar Hadash Rut 76a

title: The Song of Serach: A Jewish Lore Reactions Passover Special
paragraph:
Shalom, friends! The Angel of Death was pretty salty about "The ones who got away,‚Äù the VIPS in Jewish lore who  ascended to heaven while still alive. But that‚Äôs his beef, not mine! This is the saga of my favorite immortal, the personification of memory, music, and storytelling in Judaism, Serach Bat Asher! Welcome to The Song of Serach: A #JewishLoreReactions Passover Special!  üé∂

Sources: Genesis 37:4, Genesis 37:31-34, Genesis 41:41, Genesis 50:24-26, Exodus 13:19, Sefer HaYashar - Book of Genesis - Vayigash 9, Pirkei d'Rabi Eliezer Ch. 48, Pirkei D'Rabbi Eliezer (Higer) - "Horev" Ch. 47, Sotah 13a:14, Pesikta DeRav Kahana 11:13, Targum Jonathan on Numbers 26:46

title: Jewish Lore Reactions: The FIRST Eve
paragraph:
Shalom, friends!
Who was  the first woman in Jewish Lore? NOT the Eve who believed a weird snake with an MLM!  In the words of Lady Gaga, let me t-t-take you to the Garden of Eden to meet: Chava Rishona. Welcome to #JewishLoreReactions: The FIRST Eve ü´Ä

SOURCES:  Genesis 1: 1-25, 1:27-28, 2:7, 2:18-21,  Brachot 61a, Eruvin 18a, Mishna Avot 5:6, Midrash Tanchuma Buber - Bereshit 28:1, Legends of the Jews 1:2:48,  Bereshit Rabbah 8:1, Bereshit Rabbah 17:7, 18:4, Avot de Rabbi Natan 4:3, The Tree of Souls, Schwartz

title: Jewish Lore Reactions: The Night Queen
paragraph:
Shalom, friends! This week, a new bombshell enters the villa. And by ‚Äúvilla‚Äù I mean the Garden of Eden, and by ‚Äúbombshell‚Äù I mean the OG HBIC demon queen‚Ä¶Lilith. What will happen when Adam tries to pull her for a chat? Let‚Äôs find out‚Ä¶
Welcome to #JewishLoreReactions: The Night Queen ü¶â
#Lilith #GardenofEden #folklore 

Sources: ¬†Legends of the Jews, 1:2:43. Bereshit Rabbah 18:4. Alphabet of Ben Sira, "Toldot Ben Sira," Nusach 2, 78: Lilith. ‚ÄúLilith,‚Äù The Journal of American Folklore, Vol. 77, No. 306, Raphael Patai. ‚ÄúLilith: The Woman Who Would Be A Jew,‚Äù Aviva Cantor.

Special thanks to Dr. Sara Ronis and Geo Poor. And to Janet P., who made the joke about Senoy, Sansenoy, & Samengalof Attorneys at Law years ago :-)

title: Jewish Lore Reactions: Trouble In Paradise Part I
paragraph:
Shalom, friends! Adam‚Äôs love life was in its flop era.¬†
The First Eve had been un-made at his own request.¬†
And Lilith had left his üçë in the dust from whence it came.¬†Would the third time be the charm for our Bachelor?¬†
Or the ultimate canon event for humanity‚Ä¶and snakes? Welcome to #JewishLoreReactions: Trouble In Paradise Part I üêç

Sources: Genesis/Bereshit 1:28-3:6,
Babylonian Talmud Shabbat 95a, Eruvin 18a, Sanhedrin 38b
